reviewText: The documentaries on WWII: FRIENDS & FOES include Dept. of Defense works directed by John Ford and Frank Capra. There's also rare Nazi and Soviet shorts in this fascinating collection of vintage war footage. ST. CLAIR DVD multi-packs are reasonably priced, and offer fine quality video/audio transfers of unrestored public domain material. Discs are single-side recorded, plastic storage cases fairly sturdy, content details appear on box's back cover and most DVDs include bonus items. A related ST. CLAIR DVD set is their WWII BATTLES & VICTORY. PROGRAM for WWII: FRIENDS AND FOES-- (Viewer poll ratings and other data where available) DISC ONE - GERMANY-- (5.5) Here Is Germany (1945) (???) Adolf Hilter (1959) (5.8) Campaign in Poland ("Feldzug in Polen") (1940) (???) Warsaw Ghetto (1967) (6.7) Nuremberg Trials (USSR-1947) BONUS: Industrial Warfare DISC TWO - JAPAN-- (6.3) Kamikaze (1961) (6.1) Know Your Enemy: Japan (1945) - diir. by Frank Capra Shorts (6.9) December 7th (1943) - dir. by John Ford (7.4) To the Shores of Iwo Jima (1945) (in color) (6.8) With the Marines at Tarawa (1944) (in color) (7.0) The Battle of Midway (1942) - dir. by John Ford BONUS: Propaganda: The Quiet Weapon DISC THREE - BRITAIN-- (???) Know Your Ally: Britain (1944) (6.8) Attack! The Battle for New Britain (1944) (7.2) Desert Victory (1943) (6.7) Target for Tonight (1941) (7.8) The Battle of Britain (1943) - dir. by Frank Capra BONUS: Documenting the War

There have been several versions of World War II in which the combined Allied Power fought the Axis of Evil - Nazi Germany, Imperial Japan & Fascist Italy.

This series of war documentaries are perhaps the best ever filmed and would indeed be highly educational to kids and adults alike.

You will see rare combat footages in fighting the Nazis as well as the Japs over in Pacific.

Until the two American atomic bombs were dropped over Nagasaki and Hiroshima the Jap forces were prepared to fight to the last soldier or it seemed.

Then came the final, irrevocable and unconditional surrender of the Japs on board the USS Missouri which was presided over by General McArthur - The Supreme Allied Commander, thus ending the bloody Pacific War with the sad loss  of thousands of young American lives, ships and weapons.

However, the barbaric samurais were brought to their quacking  knees by the fighting American spirit...!

At this wonder price, the entire series are  the best bargain. So please go for it while stock last. Cheers!

This is an amazing combination of films! I believe its over 13 hours of documenting wwII . It gives you the  information about both enemies (Germany and Japan) and our ally (England)! I watch as much as I can on WWII and this is one of the best overall sets I"ve seen!!  The price isn't bad eithe!!!
